channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why the ICC Issued Arrest Warrants for Israeli and Hamas Leaders
item.description: The International Criminal Court said there were grounds to hold two Israeli leaders responsible for the crisis in Gaza, and a Hamas military leader f...

item.title: How Trump Tapped Into America’s Online Spaces and Took Control
item.description: Trump excelled at tapping into the information ecosystems where minority and young voters express their identity.

item.title: Live Updates: I.C.C. Issues Arrest Warrants for Netanyahu and Gallant
item.description: The International Criminal Court rejected Israel’s challenges to its jurisdiction, and also issued a warrant for a top Hamas official. Its chief prose...

item.title: How a new Fortune 500 CEO went from intern to head of a $13 billion company
item.description: Her mantra? "I’m going to try to work myself out of a job."

item.title: At Least 38 Killed as Gunmen Ambush Shiite Convoys in Pakistan
item.description: The attack was one of the deadliest in months of violence between Sunnis and Shiites in the Kurram region.

item.title: Beyond Meat CEO hopes to redefine the American diet. It’s why he defied haters by reformulating his products
item.description: Ethan Brown decided to make the Beyond products “unassailable from a health perspective.”

item.title: From Fox News to The Real World, Trump Recruits From the Small Screen
item.description: The president-elect is rounding out his second administration with television stars.

item.title: Who Has the ICC Charged With War Crimes?
item.description: The short list includes Omar Hassan al-Bashir, the deposed president of Sudan, and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

item.title: New York City Gets Some Rain, but Not Enough to Ease Its Drought
item.description: About two inches were forecast to fall through Saturday. Officials say it won’t be enough to fully replenish the city’s reservoirs.

item.title: Israel Strikes Near Beirut as U.S. Envoy Pushes Ahead on Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: The envoy, Amos Hochstein, was in Israel and planned to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, seeking a truce in the country’s war with the mil...

item.title: At Least 38 Killed as Gunmen Ambush Shiite Convoys in Pakistan
item.description: The attack was one of the deadliest in months of violence between Sunnis and Shiites in the Kurram region.

item.title: Getting to Know ‘Black London’
item.description: Nigerian cuisine with a twist, live reggae and a bustling market: Here’s where — and how — to experience the British capital’s vibrant and multifacete...

item.title: OpenAI partners with Wharton for a new course focused on leveraging ChatGPT for teachers
item.description: OpenAI and the Wharton School created a new course to help educators understand how to harness generative AI in the classroom.

item.title: Archegos founder Bill Hwang sentenced to 18 years for fraud that cost global investment banks billions
item.description: Judge Alvin K. Hellerstein estimated that up to nine financial institutions lost over $9 billion in the fraud.

item.title: Why Robinhood is spending $300 million to buy a wealth management platform
item.description: Robinhood wants in on the $84 trillion great wealth transfer.
